intro: Reseda paui subsp. almijarensis, commonly known as the Almijarén Reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
